snippet: A Bahraini court sentenced the democracy advocate Zainab al-Khawaja to three years in prison and fined her almost $8,000 on Thursday for insulting the king by tearing up his photograph, her lawyer and a human rights group said.
abstract: Bahrain democracy advocate Zainab al-Khawaja is sentenced to three years in prison and is fined nearly $8,000 for insulting the king by tearing up his photograph.
lead_paragraph: A Bahraini court sentenced the democracy advocate Zainab al-Khawaja to three years in prison and fined her almost $8,000 on Thursday for insulting the king by tearing up his photograph, her lawyer and a human rights group said.

headline.main: Bahrain: Democracy Advocate Gets Prison Term for Insulting King
headline.print_headline: Bahrain: Democracy Advocate Gets Prison Term for Insulting King
